prerequisite.name: Advanced Network Theory
prerequisite.description: Delving into the intricacies of network structures in biological systems, exploring small-world and scale-free networks.

prerequisite.name: Statistical Mechanics Foundations
prerequisite.description: Understanding the principles of statistical mechanics, essential for grasping complex system behaviors.

prerequisite.name: Mathematical Tools for Biophysics
prerequisite.description: Familiarizing with the mathematical tools and techniques commonly used in biophysical research.

prerequisite.name: Systems Biology Overview
prerequisite.description: Gaining a broad understanding of how biological systems function as a whole, integrating various components.

prerequisite.name: Introduction to Coarse-Graining
prerequisite.description: Exploring the basics of coarse-graining methodologies in the context of biological systems.

prerequisite.name: Epistemology in Complex Systems
prerequisite.description: Discussing the philosophical aspects of knowledge acquisition in complex systems.

prerequisite.name: Preparatory Research Methods
prerequisite.description: Enhancing research skills, focusing on methods relevant to complex systems in biophysics.

prerequisite.name: Computational Modeling Basics
prerequisite.description: Building a foundation in computational modeling as applied to biophysical systems.

prerequisite.name: Critical Reading and Analysis
prerequisite.description: Developing skills for critically reading and analyzing scientific literature in complex systems.

mainCurriculum.name: In-depth Network Analysis
mainCurriculum.description: Advanced techniques and applications in network analysis specific to biophysical systems.

mainCurriculum.name: Quantitative Modeling in Biophysics
mainCurriculum.description: Developing and applying quantitative models to understand complex biophysical systems.

mainCurriculum.name: Advanced Coarse-Graining Techniques
mainCurriculum.description: Exploring sophisticated coarse-graining methods and their implications in biological networks.

mainCurriculum.name: Philosophy of Complex Systems
mainCurriculum.description: A deeper exploration into the epistemological questions surrounding complex systems.

mainCurriculum.name: Applied Computational Modeling
mainCurriculum.description: Hands-on experience with computational modeling, tailored to biophysical research.

mainCurriculum.name: Research Methodology Advancement
mainCurriculum.description: Advancing research methods, focusing on innovative approaches in complex systems.

mainCurriculum.name: Critical Analysis and Synthesis
mainCurriculum.description: Enhancing abilities to synthesize and critically analyze emerging research in biophysics.

mainCurriculum.name: Special Topics in Biophysical Complex Systems
mainCurriculum.description: Exploring current and cutting-edge topics in the field of biophysical complex systems.

mainCurriculum.name: Research Project Design
mainCurriculum.description: Guidance in designing a rigorous research project in the realm of complex biophysical systems.

mainCurriculum.name: Comprehensive Review and Assessment
mainCurriculum.description: A thorough review and assessment to solidify your understanding and application of concepts in complex biophysical systems.
